required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy And Safety Of Sunitinib In Patients With Advanced Well-Differentiated Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study Of Sunitinib In Patients With Progressive Advanced/Metastatic Well-Differentiated Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the effect of Sunitinib on the clinical benefit response rate.

primary_outcome.description: CBR rate is defined as the percentage of participants with a best overall response of confirmed complete response (CR), confirmed partial response (PR) ,or stable disease (SD) ≥ 24 weeks. Based on RECIST, CR is defined as the disappearance of all target lesions and PR is defined as a greater than or equal to 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesion. SD is defined neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum longest dimensions since the treatment started.

secondary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the percentage of participants with a best overall response of confirmed CR or confirmed PR. Based on the response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST), CR is defined as the disappearance of all target lesions and PR is defined as a greater than or equal to 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesion.
Tumor shrinkage is defined as the percent change from baseline for the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions in participants.
PFS is defined as the time from registration to first documentation of progressive disease (PD) or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from the last subject registration to the study
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival (OS) is defined as the time from registration to documentation of death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose-corrected Trough Plasma Concentrations of Sunitinib, SU012662 and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU012662).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose of Cycle 1 Day15, Cycle 2 Day1, Cycle 3 Day1, and Cycle 4 Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Reference dose is 37.5 mg. Dose-corrected concentration is calculated from the following formula, "observed concentration multiplied by 37.5" over "actual dose". SU012662 is an active metabolite of sunitinib.

intervention.description: Sunitinib capsule will be given orally at continuous daily dosing with a dose of 37.5 mg in the morning (regardless fasting or non-fasting, One cycle will be 28days)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must have advanced (unresectable or metastatic) biopsy-proven pancreatic NET (Neuroendocrine Tumor)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with poorly differentiated neuroendocrine cancer are not eligible

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: Sunitinib 37.5 mg was orally administered once daily in a continuous daily dosing regimen (1 cycle = 4 weeks).

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: Sunitinib 37.5 mg was orally administered once daily in a continuous daily dosing regimen (1 cycle = 4 weeks).

outcome.title: Clinical Benefit Response Rate (CBR)
outcome.description: CBR rate is defined as the percentage of participants with a best overall response of confirmed complete response (CR), confirmed partial response (PR) ,or stable disease (SD) ≥ 24 weeks. Based on RECIST, CR is defined as the disappearance of all target lesions and PR is defined as a greater than or equal to 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesion. SD is defined neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum longest dimensions since the treatment started.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set was defined as the population of all enrolled participants in whom well-differentiated pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor had been diagnosed and who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: Sunitinib 37.5 mg was orally administered once daily in a continuous daily dosing regimen (1 cycle = 4 weeks).

measure.title: Clinical Benefit Response Rate (CBR)
measure.description: CBR rate is defined as the percentage of participants with a best overall response of confirmed complete response (CR), confirmed partial response (PR) ,or stable disease (SD) ≥ 24 weeks. Based on RECIST, CR is defined as the disappearance of all target lesions and PR is defined as a greater than or equal to 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesion. SD is defined neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum longest dimensions since the treatment started.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set was defined as the population of all enrolled participants in whom well-differentiated pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor had been diagnosed and who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
outcome.description: ORR is defined as the percentage of participants with a best overall response of confirmed CR or confirmed PR. Based on the response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST), CR is defined as the disappearance of all target lesions and PR is defined as a greater than or equal to 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesion.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set was defined as the population of all enrolled participants in whom well-differentiated pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor had been diagnosed and who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: Sunitinib 37.5 mg was orally administered once daily in a continuous daily dosing regimen (1 cycle = 4 weeks).

measure.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
measure.description: ORR is defined as the percentage of participants with a best overall response of confirmed CR or confirmed PR. Based on the response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST), CR is defined as the disappearance of all target lesions and PR is defined as a greater than or equal to 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesion.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set was defined as the population of all enrolled participants in whom well-differentiated pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor had been diagnosed and who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Tumor Shrinkage
outcome.description: Tumor shrinkage is defined as the percent change from baseline for the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions in participants.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set was defined as the population of all enrolled participants in whom well-differentiated pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor had been diagnosed and who received at least one dose of study medication. "n " in the measured values means number of participants analyzed in the cycle.

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from registration to first documentation of progressive disease (PD) or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set was defined as the population of all enrolled participants in whom well-differentiated pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor had been diagnosed and who received at least one dose of study medication. Median PFS had not yet been reached due to short of events.

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: Sunitinib 37.5 mg was orally administered once daily in a continuous daily dosing regimen (1 cycle = 4 weeks).

measure.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: PFS is defined as the time from registration to first documentation of progressive disease (PD) or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set was defined as the population of all enrolled participants in whom well-differentiated pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor had been diagnosed and who received at least one dose of study medication. Median PFS had not yet been reached due to short of events.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: Overall Survival (OS) is defined as the time from registration to documentation of death due to any cause.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from the last subject registration to the study
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set was defined as the population of all enrolled participants in whom well-differentiated pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor had been diagnosed and who received at least one dose of study medication. OS was not analyzed due to short of events.

measure.description: Overall Survival (OS) is defined as the time from registration to documentation of death due to any cause.

outcome.title: Dose-corrected Trough Plasma Concentrations of Sunitinib, SU012662 and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU012662).
outcome.description: Reference dose is 37.5 mg. Dose-corrected concentration is calculated from the following formula, "observed concentration multiplied by 37.5" over "actual dose". SU012662 is an active metabolite of sunitinib.
outcome.time_frame: Predose of Cycle 1 Day15, Cycle 2 Day1, Cycle 3 Day1, and Cycle 4 Day 1
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetics analysis set was defined as all participants who had at least one plasma concentration data at trough sampling with steady-state condition. "n" in the measured values means number of participants analyzed.

measure.title: Dose-corrected Trough Plasma Concentrations of Sunitinib, SU012662 and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU012662).
measure.description: Reference dose is 37.5 mg. Dose-corrected concentration is calculated from the following formula, "observed concentration multiplied by 37.5" over "actual dose". SU012662 is an active metabolite of sunitinib.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetics analysis set was defined as all participants who had at least one plasma concentration data at trough sampling with steady-state condition. "n" in the measured values means number of participants analyzed.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: Sunitinib 37.5 mg was orally administered once daily in a continuous daily dosing regimen (1 cycle = 4 weeks).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
